newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore Press foreign hits new high.
newsitem.headline: Singapore Press foreign hits new high.

text.p: The foreign tranch of Singapore Press Holdings Ltd (SPH) hit a new high of Singapore $30.40 in early Monday trading.
At 0213 GMT, the stock was changing hands at S$30.30, up eighty cents. Total volume was 362,000 units.
Dealers said a few blocks totalling 241,000 units were married at between S$29.63 and S$29.74.
"It is really absurd. The foreign is hitting a new historic high and the local shares are about to touch a new low," said a dealer with a Singapore brokerage.
The local shares were unchanged at S$12, just above its 1997 low of S$11.90. Volume was a thin 16 lots.
Analysts said there could be some interest in the newspaper company as advertising expenditure had been quite strong.

"Ad figures are up but SPH foreign is trading at a very high PE (price earnings) of about 30 times at these levels. The premium is about 155 percent over the local shares," said an analyst who has called for a hold on the foreign tranche of SPH.
The company is expected to post earnings growth of about 10 percent for the current year ending August 31, 1997, analysts said.
